verses.verse: Saying, “God has forsaken him; Pursue and take him, for there is none to deliver him.”
(Ps. 35:22) O God, do not be far from me; O my God, (Ps. 70:1) make haste to help me!
Let them be confounded and consumed Who are adversaries of my life; Let them be covered with reproach and dishonor Who seek my hurt.
But I will hope continually, And will praise You yet more and more.
My mouth shall tell of Your righteousness And Your salvation all the day, For I do not know their limits.
I will go in the strength of the Lord GOD; I will make mention of Your righteousness, of Yours only.
O God, You have taught me from my (Deut. 4:5; 6:7) youth; And to this day I declare Your wondrous works.
Now also ((Is. 46:4)) when I am old and grayheaded, O God, do not forsake me, Until I declare Your strength to this generation, Your power to everyone who is to come.
Also (Deut. 3:24; Ps. 57:10) Your righteousness, O God, is very high, You who have done great things; (Ps. 35:10) O God, who is like You?
(Ps. 60:3) You, who have shown me great and severe troubles, (Hos. 6:1, 2) Shall revive me again, And bring me up again from the depths of the earth.
You shall increase my greatness, And comfort me on every side.
Also (Ps. 92:1-3) with the lute I will praise You— And Your faithfulness, O my God! To You I will sing with the harp, O (2 Kin. 19:22; Is. 1:4) Holy One of Israel.
My lips shall greatly rejoice when I sing to You, And (Ps. 103:4) my soul, which You have redeemed.
My tongue also shall talk of Your righteousness all the day long; For they are confounded, For they are brought to shame Who seek my hurt.
(Glory and Universality of the Messiah’s Reign) A Psalm (Ps. 127:title) of Solomon. ([1]) Give the king Your judgments, O God, And Your righteousness to the king’s Son.
((Is. 9:7; 11:2-5; 32:1)) He will judge Your people with righteousness, And Your poor with justice.
(Ps. 85:10) The mountains will bring peace to the people, And the little hills, by righteousness.
(Is. 11:4) He will bring justice to the poor of the people; He will save the children of the needy, And will break in pieces the oppressor.
They shall fear You (Ps. 72:7, 17; 89:36) As long as the sun and moon endure, Throughout all generations.
(Deut. 32:2; 2 Sam. 23:4; Hos. 6:3) He shall come down like rain upon the grass before mowing, Like showers that water the earth.
